snippet: The criminal case of Sergey Aleynikov, who was accused of stealing computer code, will proceed to a jury after his last-ditch, midtrial effort to toss out the case came up short.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Daniel P Conviser rejects former Goldman Sachs programmer Sergey Aleynikov's request for dismissal; ruling paves way for jury trial on accusations that Aleynikov stole secret source code from company.
lead_paragraph: The criminal case of Sergey Aleynikov, who was accused of stealing computer code, will proceed to a jury after his last-ditch, midtrial effort to toss out the case came up short.

headline.main: Ruling Clears Way for Jury Verdict on Former Goldman Sachs Programmer
headline.print_headline: Ruling Clears Way for Jury Verdict on Former Goldman Sachs Programmer
